intro: Centaurea hierapolitana, commonly known as the Hierapolis centaury, is a flowering plant native to Turkey. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its striking blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and is adapted to arid environments. It has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, bract-like structures beneath its flowers. Centaurea hierapolitana is often found in mountainous regions and is considered a rare species in its native habitat.
